document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic review of the grassland leafhopper genus Aconurella Ribaut (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Deltocephalinae: Chiasmini) from China with the description of two new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Greenish-ochraceous (Plate I: A, B). Vertex with a central spot, two transversely striae between eyes, markings sometimes reduced to absent (Plate I: Eâ€“I). Frontoclypeus entirely black or ochraceous, obliquely striae in the lateral regions (Plate I: J). Forewing macropterous (Plate I: A, B).

Male genitalia. The darkly sclerotized part of pygofer side on posteroventral margin more than half its length, with small spines, dorsoapical margin without or with sparse small spinules (
Figs 1
Aâ€“C); connective with arms close together distally (
Fig. 1
G); aedeagus shaft gently curved dorsally (
Fig. 1
H).
Female. Sternite VII produced in middle (Plate I: D).

Material examined. China : Zhejiang Prov.:
13 , Qingliang Mountain, 530m ,

Remarks. Based on the figures of
A . orientalis
(
Ishihara, 1954 : 377 ,
Fig. 1
), it should be a synonym of this species. Although the aedeagus apex is slightly different, this difference could be an artifact of the perspective of drawing.

PLATE I.
Aconurella prolixa (Matsumura)
. A & B: habitus, dorsal view; C: habitus, lateral view; D: the end of female abdomen, ventral view; Eâ€“I: head and thorax, dorsal view; J: face.
